<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Attention: Chief Legal Officer </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Reference is hereby made to the
Class&nbsp;C Exchange Agreement, dated as of &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;, 2021 (the &#147;<U>Exchange Agreement</U>&#148;), among StepStone Group Inc., a Delaware corporation (the &#147;<U>Company</U>&#148;), StepStone Group LP, a Delaware limited
partnership (the &#147;<U>Partnership</U>&#148;), and the Partnership Unitholders (as defined therein) from time to time party thereto. Capitalized terms used but not defined herein shall have the meanings given to them in the Exchange Agreement.
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">The undersigned Partnership Unitholder hereby transfers to the Partnership or the Company (in the event that the Company determined to effect a direct
exchange with the undersigned Partnership Unitholder) the number of Exchangeable Units set forth below, in Exchange for either shares of Class&nbsp;A Common Stock to be issued in its name (or the name of its designee) as set forth below or, at the
option of the Company, the Cash Settlement payable to the account set forth below, in accordance with the terms of the Exchange Agreement. </P> <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>

plan.]</I> [The Partnership Unitholder has entered into a Rule <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">10b5-1</FONT> plan (&#147;<U>Plan</U>&#148;) with Morgan Stanley on or about the date hereof. Partnership Unitholder acknowledges and agrees that to the
extent Class&nbsp;A Common Stock is to be sold pursuant to the Plan, the shares delivered upon Exchange shall be used first for such purpose.] </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><U>Exercise Contingencies</U>: In accordance with Section&nbsp;2.1(a)(i)(C) of the Exchange Agreement, the undersigned Partnership Unitholder notifies the
Company that this election to exchange is contingent upon: </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(1) the Exchange occurring on [DATE] (or as soon thereafter as the Company can effect such
Exchange) (&#147;<U>Exchange Date</U>&#148;); and </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(2) <I>[add other conditions, as desired, for example, to track the Rule
<FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">10b5-1</FONT> plan]</I> [the closing price of the Company&#146;s Class&nbsp;A Common Stock is at least $[XX.XX] per share on the last trading day prior to the Exchange Date]. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">The undersigned Partnership Unitholder hereby represents and warrants that (i)&nbsp;the Partnership Unitholder has all requisite legal capacity and authority
to execute and deliver this Exchange Notice and to perform the undersigned&#146;s obligations hereunder; (ii)&nbsp;the execution and delivery of this Exchange Notice and the consummation of the Exchange have been duly authorized by all necessary
corporate or other entity action on the part of the Partnership Unitholder; (iii)&nbsp;this Exchange Notice constitutes a legal, valid and binding obligation of the undersigned Partnership Unitholder enforceable against it in accordance with its
terms, except as enforcement may be limited by equitable principles or by bankruptcy, insolvency, reorganization, moratorium or similar laws relating to or limiting creditors&#146; rights generally; (iv)&nbsp;the Exchangeable Units subject to this
Exchange Notice are being transferred to the Partnership or the Company, as applicable, free and clear of any pledge, lien, security interest, encumbrance, equities or claim (except for those arising under the Exchange Agreement, the Policies and
the Partnership Agreement); (v) no consent, approval, authorization, order, registration or qualification of any third party or with any court or governmental agency or body having jurisdiction over the undersigned or the Exchangeable Units subject
to this Exchange Notice is required to be obtained by the undersigned for the transfer of such Exchangeable Units to the Partnership or the Company, as applicable; (vi)&nbsp;the Partnership Unitholder is an &#147;accredited investor&#148; within the
meaning of Regulation D promulgated under the Securities Act, and is not acquiring the shares of Class&nbsp;A Common Stock with the intent to distribute them in violation of the Securities Act; (vii)&nbsp;the Partnership Unitholder is not aware of
any material <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-public</FONT> information concerning the Company or the Class&nbsp;A Common Stock; and (viii)&nbsp;the Class&nbsp;C Units being exchanged have been held by the undersigned for a period of at least
one year (after taking into account any tacking of the holding period allowed by Rule 144(d) under the Securities Act). </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">The undersigned hereby
irrevocably constitutes and appoints any officer of the Partnership as the attorney of the undersigned, with full power of substitution and resubstitution in the premises, to do any and all things and to take any and all actions that may be
necessary to transfer the Partnership Units subject to this Exchange Notice and to deliver to the undersigned the shares of Class&nbsp;A Common Stock or the Cash Settlement to be delivered in Exchange therefor. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the undersigned, by authority duly given, has caused this Exchange Notice to be executed and delivered by the undersigned or by its duly
authorized attorney. </P> <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P><DIV ALIGN="right">

<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>EXHIBIT B </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">FORM OF </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">JOINDER </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">This Joinder (&#147;<U>Joinder</U>&#148;) is a joinder to the Exchange Agreement, dated as of &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;, 2021 (the
&#147;<U>Agreement</U>&#148;), among StepStone Group Inc., a Delaware corporation (the &#147;<U>Company</U>&#148;), StepStone Group LP, a Delaware limited partnership (the &#147;<U>Partnership</U>&#148;), and each of the Partnership Unitholders from
time to time party thereto. Capitalized terms used but not defined in this Joinder shall have the meanings given to them in the Agreement. The Partnership, the Company and the undersigned agree that all questions concerning the construction,
validity and interpretation of this Joinder shall be governed by, and construed in accordance with, the law of the State of Delaware, without giving effect to any choice or conflict of law provision or rule, notwithstanding that public policy in
Delaware or any other forum jurisdiction might indicate that the laws of that or any other jurisdiction should otherwise apply based on contacts with such state or otherwise. In the event of any conflict between this Joinder and the Agreement, the
terms of this Joinder shall control. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">The undersigned, having acquired shares of Class&nbsp;C Units, hereby joins and enters into the Agreement. By
signing and returning this Joinder to the Partnership and the Company, the undersigned (A)&nbsp;accepts and agrees to be bound by and subject to all of the terms and conditions of and agreements of a Partnership Unitholder contained in the
Agreement, with all attendant rights, duties and obligations of a Partnership Unitholder thereunder and (B)&nbsp;makes each of the representations and warranties of a Partnership Unitholder set forth in <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;3.3</U> of the
Agreement as fully as if such representations and warranties were set forth herein. The parties to the Agreement shall treat the execution and delivery hereof by the undersigned as the execution and delivery of the Agreement by the undersigned and,
upon receipt of this Joinder by the Partnership and the Company, the signature of the undersigned set forth below shall constitute a counterpart signature to the signature page of the Agreement. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>Unitholder Name: </B></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="40%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt">


<TR>

<TD WIDTH="13%"></TD>

<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="1%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="86%"></TD></TR>


<TR STYLE="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt">

<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt; border-bottom:1px solid #000000; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&nbsp;</P></TD></TR>

</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="right"><B>Exhibit E </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>Earnout Addendum </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Capitalized terms used but not defined in this <U>Exhibit E</U> shall have the meanings ascribed to such terms in the Agreement, of which this
<U>Exhibit E</U> forms a part. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>Section</B><B></B><B>&nbsp;1.1 </B><B>Earnout</B><B> Consideration</B>. Subject to and in accordance
with <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;2.</U><U>12</U> of the Agreement and this <U>Exhibit E</U>, Parent shall make the Earnout Payment (if any) to the Sellers in the amount and pursuant to the payment mechanics and procedures described in the
remaining provisions of this <U>Exhibit E</U>. Furthermore, in accordance with Section&nbsp;2.12 of the Agreement, the parties acknowledge that the Earnout Payment (if any) is intended by the parties to be treated as part of the Merger Consideration
and except as otherwise required by Law, the parties will treat any such Earnout Payment as an adjustment to the Merger Consideration for Tax purposes. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>Section</B><B></B><B>&nbsp;1.2 </B><B>Certain Defined Terms</B>. For the purposes hereof, the following terms have the meanings set forth
below: </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Administration Revenue</U>&#148; means revenue generated from the provision by GBOS or its Affiliates of fund
administration or related services to investment management firms that are not Affiliates of GBOS. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Distribution Fees</U>&#148;
means any placement fees, commissions, bonuses or other amounts paid or payable to third parties or commission based compensation paid or payable to the business development personnel of Parent or its Affiliates in respect of distribution (however
styled) of Qualifying Greenspring Products and Solutions. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Earnout Period</U>&#148; means the period beginning on January&nbsp;1,
2024 and ending on December&nbsp;31, 2024. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Group Companies Change of Control</U>&#148; means (i)&nbsp;any sale of 50% or more of
the voting securities or voting power of the Group Companies to one or more unaffiliated Persons (in each case, other than a Seller or any Person directly or indirectly Affiliated with a Seller), (ii) any sale of all or substantially all of the
assets of the Group Companies to one or more unaffiliated Persons (in each case, other than a Seller or any Person directly or indirectly Affiliated with a Seller), or (iii)&nbsp;any merger or other transaction pursuant to which over 50% of the
voting securities or voting power of the Group Companies immediately after such transaction is owned or controlled (directly or indirectly) by Persons that are not Affiliates of Parent (in each case, other than a Seller or any Person directly or
indirectly Affiliated with a Seller). Notwithstanding the foregoing, the sale, <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">spin-out</FONT> or transfer of GBOS (or all or substantially all of its assets) on a stand-alone basis shall not constitute a Group
Companies Change of Control. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Multiplier</U>&#148; means the fraction obtained by dividing $50,000,000 by $23,700,000. </P>
</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Net Management Fee Revenues</U>&#148; means the gross fee income of Parent derived
from fixed management or investment advisory fees paid by Clients or Parent Clients with respect to Qualifying Greenspring Products and Solutions, net of any Distribution Fees, waived management fees, deemed contribution offsets, discounts or
rebates ceded to such Clients or Parent Clients in connection with such Qualifying Greenspring Products and Solutions. For the avoidance of doubt, Net Management Fee Revenue does not include revenue derived from any profits interest, carried
interest, incentive fees or similar entitlement to participate in investment returns. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Qualifying Greenspring Products and
Solutions</U>&#148; means investment products, solutions or dedicated advisory engagements of the Group Companies provided to Clients to the extent related to primary, secondary or direct investments (including
<FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">co-investments)</FONT> in early stage, growth equity and venture capital funds or companies. Qualifying Greenspring Products and Solutions include Consenting Clients, but do not include (i)&nbsp;investment products
or solutions of the Group Companies to the extent they do not relate to primary, secondary or direct investments (including <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">co-investments)</FONT> in early stage, growth equity and venture capital funds or companies,
(ii)&nbsp;investment products or solutions provided by Parent or its Affiliates or Subsidiaries (excluding any of the Group Companies) at any time prior to the Closing Date and any renewals of those products or solutions or successors to those
products or solutions, in each case, relating to primary, secondary or direct investments (including <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">co-investments)</FONT> in early stage, growth equity and venture capital funds or companies, in the cases of the
foregoing clauses (i)&nbsp;or (ii), regardless of whether such products or solutions are provided by any Group Company Employee, or (iii)&nbsp;any investment products or solutions of businesses or Persons acquired, consolidated, merged or otherwise
combined with the Group Companies after the Closing Date. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Qualifying Revenue</U>&#148; means the Net Management Fee Revenues
derived from each Qualifying Greenspring Product and Solution (not including any Administration Revenue) earned and accrued in respect of the Earnout Period, calculated in a manner consistent with the financial statements of Parent. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>Section&nbsp;1.3 Payment and Procedures </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(a) For purposes of facilitating the administration of the calculation of the Earnout Payment, in July and January of each year during the
period commencing on the Closing Date and ending on January&nbsp;31, 2025, the Seller Representative and Parent shall meet (either in person or telephonically) to review each new investment product or solution that was formed by Parent or its
Affiliates since the date of such last meeting to determine whether such product or solution is a Qualifying Greenspring Product and Solution. Parent and Seller Representative shall consider all such investment products and solutions and shall, in
good faith, determine whether such product or solution is a Qualifying Greenspring Product and Solution within thirty (30)&nbsp;Business Days of such meeting. Any dispute as to whether or not such investment product or solution is a Qualifying
Greenspring Product and Solution shall be resolved in accordance with the dispute resolution provisions set forth in clauses (c), (d) and (e)&nbsp;of this Section&nbsp;1.3 below. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(b) Parent shall deliver to the Seller Representative a written statement (the &#147;<U>Earnout Statement</U>&#148;) no later than two Business
Days after the date on which Parent&#146;s quarterly report on Form <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">10-Q</FONT> for the quarterly period ending December&nbsp;31, 2024 is filed with the SEC (and if Parent is not required to file such report, then
the last date on which such report would have been required to be filed with the SEC), setting forth in reasonable detail a calculation of the Earnout Payment, including the Net Management Fee Revenues derived from each Qualifying Greenspring
Product and Solution for the Earnout Period. </P>
</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(c) During the 30 days immediately following the Seller Representative&#146;s receipt of the
Earnout Statement, the Seller Representative shall be permitted to review Parent&#146;s calculations set forth in such Earnout Statement, and granted reasonable access to Parent&#146;s and its Representative&#146;s working papers and other reports
used by Parent to prepare such calculations; <U>provided</U>, that Parent&#146;s external third-party accountants shall not be obligated to make any work papers available except in accordance with such accountants&#146; disclosure procedures and
then only after the <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-client</FONT> party has signed an agreement relating to access to such work papers in customary form and in substance reasonably acceptable to such accountants. Such Earnout Statement shall
become final and binding upon the parties on the 30th day following receipt thereof by the Seller Representative unless the Seller Representative gives written notice of its disagreement (an &#147;<U>Earnout</U><U> Notice of Disagreement</U>&#148;)
in good faith with such calculation to Parent prior to such date, which notice shall specify in reasonable detail the nature and amount of any disagreement so asserted. An Earnout Notice of Disagreement shall only be valid to the extent the
disagreements described therein relate to mathematical errors or disagreements as to the application of the relevant definitions and other applicable provisions in this Earnout Addendum and the Agreement. If a timely Earnout Notice of Disagreement
is received by Parent and the disagreements specified therein are validly raised in accordance with the foregoing sentence, then such Earnout Statement (as revised as contemplated in clause (x)&nbsp;or (y) below) shall become final and binding upon
the parties on the earlier of (x)&nbsp;the date the parties resolve in writing any differences they have with respect to every matter specified in the Earnout Notice of Disagreement, or (y)&nbsp;the date any matters properly in dispute are finally
resolved in writing by the Independent Accounting Firm as set forth in Section&nbsp;1.3(d) below. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(d) During the 15 days immediately
following the delivery of an Earnout Notice of Disagreement (an &#147;<U>Earnout</U><U> Resolution Period</U>&#148;), Parent and the Seller Representative shall seek in good faith to resolve any differences validly raised in such Earnout Notice of
Disagreement. If, at the conclusion of an Earnout Resolution Period, the Seller Representative and Parent have not reached an agreement on any disagreement validly raised in such Earnout Notice of Disagreement (to the extent specified in the Earnout
Notice of Disagreement delivered in accordance with Section&nbsp;1.3(c) above), then, at the written election of either the Seller Representative or Parent, all amounts and issues specified in such Earnout Notice of Disagreement remaining in dispute
shall be promptly submitted by the Seller Representative and Parent to the Independent Accounting Firm for a determination resolving such amounts and issues. After reviewing such written submissions and any underlying materials as the Independent
Accounting Firm reasonably requests (and which Parent and the Seller Representative shall make readily available), the Independent Accounting Firm shall promptly (and in any event, within twenty (20)&nbsp;days) make a final determination of the
Revenue for the Earnout Period based solely on presentations by Parent and the Seller Representative (and not by independent review), which determination shall be binding on the parties; <U>provided</U>, <U>however</U>, that the foregoing shall not
prohibit Parent or the Seller Representative from bringing any Action (including any Action seeking an injunction, specific performance, or other equitable relief)&nbsp;(x) in connection with an actual or threatened breach by a party of the terms
and conditions set forth in this Earnout Addendum or (y)&nbsp;to enforce any final determination by the Independent Accounting Firm, in each case, in any court or other tribunal of </P>
</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
competent jurisdiction and otherwise in accordance with Section&nbsp;8.10 of the Agreement. In making such determination, the Independent Accounting Firm shall function as an expert and not as an
arbitrator. The Independent Accounting Firm (i)&nbsp;shall be bound by the principles set forth in this Section&nbsp;1.3, (ii) shall limit its review to matters specifically set forth and validly raised in the Earnout Notice of Disagreement and
(iii)&nbsp;shall not assign a value to the Earnout Payment greater than the greatest value for the Earnout Payment claimed by either party or less than the smallest value for the Earnout Payment claimed by either party. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(e) Section&nbsp;2.11(d) of the Agreement shall apply hereunder <I>mutatis mutandis</I>. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(f) Subject to Parent&#146;s offset rights as set forth in Section&nbsp;5.15(g) of the Agreement and withholding rights and obligations as set
forth in Section&nbsp;2.13 of the Agreement, within 10 Business Days after the applicable Earnout Payment is finally determined pursuant to this Agreement, Parent shall pay (or cause SSGLP to pay, in whole or in part) to the Seller Representative in
cash the Earnout Payment (for distribution to the Sellers in accordance with their Allocated Shares), net of applicable withholding Taxes (if any), by wire transfer of immediately available funds in U.S. dollars to such account as may be designated
in writing by the Seller Representative at least two (2)&nbsp;Business Days in advance. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(g) All Earnout Payments shall be treated as
deferred contingent purchase price eligible for installment sale treatment under Section&nbsp;453 of the Code and any corresponding provision of U.S. state or local or <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-U.S.</FONT> Law, as appropriate (subject to
imputation of interest under Section&nbsp;483 or Section&nbsp;1274 of the Code) unless otherwise required by applicable Law. The parties shall file all Tax Returns and take all positions for Tax purposes consistent with the foregoing. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>Section&nbsp;1.4 Earnout Payments </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(a) Pursuant to the mechanics and procedures in Section&nbsp;1.3, in the event the Qualifying Revenue for the Earnout Period is equal to or
greater than $106,600,000 (the &#147;<U>Lower Revenue Threshold</U>&#148;), the Earnout Payment shall be the amount specified in Section&nbsp;1.4(b) (the &#147;<U>Earnout Payment</U>&#148;). In the event the Qualifying Revenue for the Earnout Period
is less than the Lower Revenue Threshold, the Sellers shall not be entitled to the Earnout Payment. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:9%; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(b) In the event the
Qualifying Revenue for the Earnout Period is: </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:13%; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(i) equal to the Lower Revenue Threshold, then the Earnout Payment shall be
an amount equal to $25,000,000; </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:13%; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(ii) greater than the Lower Revenue Threshold, but less than $130,300,000 (the
&#147;<U>Upper Revenue Threshold</U>&#148;), the Earnout Payment shall be an amount equal to the sum of $25,000,000 <U>plus</U> an amount equal to the product of (x)&nbsp;the Multiplier <U>multiplied by</U> (y)&nbsp;(A) the Qualifying Revenue
<U>less</U> (B)&nbsp;the Lower Revenue Target; and </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:13%; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(iii) equal to or greater than the Upper Revenue Threshold, then the
Earnout Payment shall be an amount equal to $75,000,000. </P>
</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>Section&nbsp;1.5 Additional Covenants and Agreements. </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(a) Following the Closing and until the end of the Earnout Period, (i)&nbsp;Parent and SSGLP shall have the right to own and operate the Group
Companies in any way that they deem appropriate, in their sole discretion, (ii)&nbsp;Parent and its Affiliates shall have no obligation to own or operate the Group Companies in order to maximize the Earnout Payment, (iii)&nbsp;there is no guarantee
and assurance that any Seller will receive all or any portion an Earnout Payment, (iv)&nbsp;neither Parent nor any of its Affiliates owe any fiduciary duty to any Seller or any of its direct or indirect equityholders, (v)&nbsp;the parties intend the
express provisions of the Agreement and this <U>Exhibit E</U> to govern their contractual relationship in respect of the Earnout Payments and (vi)&nbsp;the Sellers acknowledge and agree that the contingent right to receive payment the Earnout
Payment is not a security; <U>provided</U>, <U>however</U>, that following the Closing and until the end of the Earnout Period, Parent (a)&nbsp;shall not, without the consent of the Seller Representative, take any action that is intended to
eliminate or materially reduce the Earnout Payment or impair the ability to earn the Earnout Payment, (b)&nbsp;shall use commercially reasonable efforts to ensure the Group Companies have reasonably sufficient working capital and staffing to
continue to operate and develop the Qualifying Greenspring Products and Solutions, (c)&nbsp;shall not require any continuing investment team employee of the Group Companies to spend a material amount of time on responsibilities (other than serving
on any investment committee or the Private Equity Executive Committee of Parent) unrelated to Qualifying Greenspring Products and Solutions (unless otherwise consented to by the Seller Representative) and (d)&nbsp;shall maintain books and records of
the Group Companies in a manner necessary to enable the tracking and calculation of the Earnout Payment hereunder. Attached hereto as Schedule A to this Earnout Addendum are operating principles to inform governance and integration with respect to
the Earnout Payment described herein. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(b) In the event that a Group Companies Change of Control occurs prior to the end of the Earnout
Period and Parent or its Affiliates receive an aggregate amount of cash or publicly traded securities in connection with such Group Companies Change of Control representing net proceeds of at least $1,000,000,000, Parent shall pay to the Seller
Representative (for distribution to the Sellers in accordance with their Allocated Shares) an aggregate amount equal to $75,000,000 (any such payment, the &#147;<U>Acceleration Payment</U>&#148;) as promptly as possible after the occurrence of such
Group Companies Change of Control. In the event that an Acceleration Payment is paid or becomes payable, no other amount or Earnout Payment shall by payable hereunder. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(c) No direct or indirect right or interest of a Seller under Section&nbsp;2.12 of the Agreement or any provision this Earnout Addendum may be
assigned, transferred or otherwise disposed of, in whole or in part, and any attempted assignment or transfer shall be void and of no force or effect without the prior written consent of Parent. The Sellers acknowledge and agree that Parent&#146;s
obligations with respect to the Earnout Payment shall be deemed satisfied upon payment of the Earnout Payment in accordance with the Agreement and this <U>Exhibit E</U>. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(d) Any Seller&#146;s right and interest to any portion of the Earnout Payment shall not be represented by any certificate or other instrument
or otherwise represent any ownership interest in Parent. </P>
</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><U>Schedule A </U></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">In order to achieve the Qualifying Revenue in calendar 2024 that is necessary for the Earnout Payment, new and successor products and
solutions may need to be introduced. The nature, size, timing and related characteristics of those new and successor venture capital and growth equity products and solutions may be important considerations with regard to whether or not an Earnout
Payment is ever earned. With regard to how new and successor products and solutions will be approved and introduced, the parties have discussed that the then partners of the venture capital and growth equity sector team of the private equity asset
class team of SSGLP (the &#147;<U>VC and Growth Equity Sector Team</U>&#148;), after good faith consultation with the private equity executive committee of SSGLP, shall make such decisions. Initially, the partners of the VC and Growth Equity Sector
Team will be Messrs: Avirett, Borton, Callahan, Coelho, Lim, Adair Newhall, Ashton Newhall, and Somerville and Ms.&nbsp;Kang. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">It is
understood and agreed that nothing in this Schedule A or the Earnout Addendum shall confer any employment or similar rights to any individuals and that at all times Parent retains the ultimate control of the VC and Growth Equity Sector Team and the
private equity executive committee of SSGLP, including but not limited to the composition thereof. The purpose of this Schedule A is to provide context to the Earnout Addendum with regard to discussions among the parties concerning how decisions
will be made relating to new and successor venture capital and growth equity products and solutions of Parent and its Affiliates following the Closing and prior to December&nbsp;31, 2024. </P>
</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="right"><B>Exhibit G </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:24pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>AMENDED AND RESTATED STOCKHOLDERS AGREEMENT </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">This AMENDED AND RESTATED STOCKHOLDERS AGREEMENT, dated as of &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;, 2021 (the &#147;<U>Effective Date</U>&#148;), by and among
(i)&nbsp;StepStone Group Inc., a Delaware corporation (the &#147;<U>Company</U>&#148;), (ii) StepStone Group LP, a Delaware limited partnership (the &#147;<U>Partnership</U>&#148;), and (iii)&nbsp;the persons and entities named as Class&nbsp;B
Holders and Greenspring Holders on the signature pages hereto. Capitalized terms used herein without definition shall have the meanings set forth in <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;1.1</U>. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:24pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><U>RECITALS </U></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">WHEREAS, the Company, the
Partnership and certain of the Class&nbsp;B Holders are party to that certain Stockholders Agreement of the Company, dated as of September&nbsp;18, 2020 (the &#147;<U>Original Agreement</U>&#148;), which provides for certain governance rights and
obligations of the Company and its stockholders; </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">WHEREAS, the Class&nbsp;B Holders, together with their Permitted Transferees, Beneficially Own
(x)&nbsp;shares of the Company&#146;s Class&nbsp;A Common Stock and/or (y)&nbsp;shares of the Company&#146;s Class&nbsp;B common stock, par value $0.001 per share (the &#147;<U>Class</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;B Common Stock</U>&#148; and, together with the
Class&nbsp;A Common Stock, the &#147;<U>Common Stock</U>&#148;) and Class&nbsp;B partnership units in the Partnership (&#147;<U>Class</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;B Units</U>&#148;), which Class&nbsp;B Units, subject to certain restrictions, are exchangeable
from time to time at the option of the Beneficial Owner thereof for shares of Class&nbsp;A Common Stock pursuant to the terms of an Exchange Agreement between the Company, the Partnership and its Class&nbsp;B unitholders (the
&#147;<U>Class</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;B Exchange Agreement</U>&#148;) and the Ninth Amended and Restated Limited Partnership Agreement of the Partnership (as may be amended from time to time, the &#147;<U>Partnership Agreement</U>&#148;); </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">WHEREAS, on July&nbsp;7, 2021, the Company and the Greenspring Holders entered into that certain Transaction Agreement, pursuant to which the Company agreed
to acquire Greenspring Associates, LLC and its subsidiaries and certain of its Affiliates, in exchange for cash, shares of Class&nbsp;A Common Stock and Class&nbsp;C partnership units in the Partnership (the &#147;<U>Class</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;C
Units</U>&#148;), which Class&nbsp;C Units are exchangeable into shares of Class&nbsp;A Common Stock pursuant to the terms of that certain Class&nbsp;C Exchange Agreement entered into by and among the Company, the Partnership and the Class&nbsp;C
unitholders of the Partnership (the &#147;<U>Class</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;C Exchange Agreement</U>&#148;); and </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">WHEREAS, the parties hereto desire to amend
and restate the Original Agreement in its entirety as follows in order to admit the Greenspring Holders as parties and in order to provide for certain governance rights, transfer restrictions and other matters with respect to Class&nbsp;B Holders
and the Greenspring Holders on and after the Effective Date. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual agreements and understandings set forth
herein, the parties hereto hereby agree as follows: </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:24pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>ARTICLE I </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>DEFINITIONS </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Section&nbsp;1.1
<U>Definitions</U>. As used in this Agreement, the following terms shall have the following respective meanings: </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Affiliate</U>&#148; means, with
respect to any specified Person, (a)&nbsp;any Person that directly or indirectly through one or more intermediaries controls, or is controlled by, or is under common control with, such specified Person or (b)&nbsp;a Permitted Transferee of such
Person; <U>provided</U>, that the Company, the Partnership and their respective subsidiaries shall not be deemed to be Affiliates of the Class&nbsp;B Holders or the Greenspring Holders. As used in this definition, (i)&nbsp;the term
&#147;control&#148; means the possession, directly or indirectly, of the power to direct or cause the direction of the management and policies of a Person, whether through ownership of voting securities, by contract or otherwise; and (ii)&nbsp;the
terms &#147;controlled by&#148; and &#147;under common control&#148; shall have correlative meanings. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Agreement</U>&#148; means this Amended and
Restated Stockholders Agreement as in effect on the date hereof and as hereafter from time to time amended, modified or supplemented in accordance with the terms hereof. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">1 </P>

</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Beneficial Ownership</U>&#148; has the same meaning given to it in
<U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;13(d)</U> under the Exchange Act and the rules thereunder, except that, for purposes of this Agreement, (i)&nbsp;Beneficial Ownership shall not be attributed to any Person as a result of any &#147;group&#148; deemed to
form as a result of this Agreement, (ii)&nbsp;no Person shall Beneficially Own any Company Shares to be issued upon the exercise of options, warrants, restricted stock units or similar rights granted pursuant to the Company&#146;s equity
compensation plans, unless and until such shares are actually issued and (iii)&nbsp;no Person shall be deemed to Beneficially Own any Company Shares issuable with respect to Class&nbsp;B2 Units of the Partnership unless and until the Full Vesting
Date (as such term is defined in the Partnership Agreement) for such Class&nbsp;B2 Units has occurred. The terms &#147;<U>Beneficially Own</U>&#148; and &#147;<U>Beneficial Owner</U>&#148; shall have correlative meanings. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Board Designees</U>&#148; has the meaning set forth in <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;2.2(b)</U>. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Board of Directors</U>&#148; means the Board of Directors of the Company. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Chair</U>&#148; means the Chair of the Class&nbsp;B Committee, as designated by the Class&nbsp;B Committee from time to time. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Class</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;A Common Stock</U>&#148; means the Class&nbsp;A common stock, par value $0.001 per share, of the Company. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Class</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;B Committee</U>&#148; means the committee selected by the terms of this Agreement to, among other things, make decisions
with respect to the matters set forth herein. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Class</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;B Common Stock</U>&#148; has the meaning set forth in the recitals. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Class</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;B Exchange Agreement</U>&#148; has the meaning set forth in the recitals. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Class</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;B Holder</U>&#148; means a Person from time to time Beneficially Owning Class&nbsp;B Common Stock. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Class</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;B Supermajority</U>&#148; means Class&nbsp;B Holders holding two thirds (2/3) of the outstanding Company Shares (excluding,
for this purpose, Company Shares that are subject to vesting (but including, for the avoidance of doubt, any such shares previously subject to vesting to the extent vested)) held by all Class&nbsp;B Holders or over which Class&nbsp;B Holders or
their Permitted Transferees have voting control. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Class</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;B Units</U>&#148; has the meaning set forth in the recitals. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Class</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;C Exchange Agreement</U>&#148; has the meaning set forth in the recitals. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Class</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;C Units</U>&#148; has the meaning set forth in the recitals. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Committee Majority</U>&#148; means Committee Members representing more than 50% of the Voting Power held by all Committee Members. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Committee Member</U>&#148; means a member of the Class&nbsp;B Committee. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Common Shares</U>&#148; means shares of the Company&#146;s Common Stock. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Common Stock</U>&#148; has the meaning set forth in the recitals. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Company</U>&#148; has the meaning set forth in the preamble and includes its successors. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Company Shares</U>&#148; means, as of any date of determination, (i)&nbsp;all outstanding shares of Common Stock, (ii)&nbsp;all shares of Common
Stock issuable upon exercise, conversion or exchange of any option, warrant or convertible security (including Class&nbsp;B, Class&nbsp;B2 or Class&nbsp;C Units) or the vesting of any restricted stock unit, (iii)&nbsp;all shares of Common Stock
directly or indirectly issued or issuable with respect to the securities referred to in clauses (i)&nbsp;or (ii)&nbsp;above by way of unit or stock dividend or unit or stock split, or in connection with a combination of units or shares,
recapitalization, merger, consolidation or other reorganization; and (iv)&nbsp;any other securities that may hereafter be issued by the Company that have the right to vote on any matter presented to the stockholders of the Company for a vote, in all
cases over which a Person has, exercises, or has the legal ability to exercise voting power. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Director</U>&#148; means a member of the Board of
Directors. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Effective Date</U>&#148; has the meaning set forth in the preamble. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Exchange Act&#148;</U> has the meaning set forth in <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;5.12</U>. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">2 </P>

</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Greenspring Holders</U>&#148; means Ashton Newhall and Jim Lim and any other former holder of
Class&nbsp;C Units whose Class&nbsp;C Units are exchanged for shares of Class&nbsp;A Common Stock pursuant to the Class&nbsp;C Exchange Agreement. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Greenspring Merger Shares</U>&#148; means the shares of Class&nbsp;A Common Stock issued to the Greenspring Holders as consideration in the Mergers.
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Greenspring Mergers</U>&#148; means the mergers contemplated by the Transaction Agreement, pursuant to which (i)&nbsp;Alto Merger Sub 1, Inc.
will be merged with and into Greenspring Associates, Inc., a wholly owned subsidiary of the Company, with Greenspring Associates, Inc. surviving such merger and continuing as a wholly owned subsidiary of the Company; and (ii)&nbsp;Alto Merger Sub 2,
Inc. will be merged with and into Greenspring Back Office Solutions, Inc., a wholly owned subsidiary of the Company, with Greenspring Back Offices Solution, Inc. surviving such merger and continuing as a wholly owned subsidiary of the Company. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Necessary Action</U>&#148; means, with respect to a specified result, all commercially reasonable and lawful actions required to cause such result
that are within the power of a specified Person, including without limitation (i)&nbsp;causing all Company Shares to be present or represented at any meeting of stockholders of the Company for purposes of determining whether a quorum has been
established, (ii)&nbsp;voting (or causing to be voted) the Company Shares, or granting a proxy (or causing a proxy to be granted) with respect to the voting of the Company Shares, (iii)&nbsp;duly executing and delivering (or causing to be duly
executed and delivered) any action by written consent of stockholders in lieu of a meeting with respect to the Company Shares, or granting a proxy (or causing the granting of a proxy) with respect to action by written consent in lieu of a meeting
with respect to the Company Shares, (iv)&nbsp;adopting or causing the adoption of stockholders&#146; resolutions and amendments to the organizational documents of the Company or Partnership, (v)&nbsp;executing and delivering agreements and
instruments, (vi)&nbsp;making, or causing to be made, with governmental, administrative or regulatory authorities, all filings, registrations or similar actions that are required to achieve such result and (vii)&nbsp;requesting members of the Board
of Directors, subject to any fiduciary duties that such members may have as Directors of the Company (including pursuant to <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;2.2(c)</U>), to act in a certain manner, including requesting members of the Board of Directors
or any nominating or similar committee of the Board of Directors to recommend the appointment of any Board Designees as provided by this Agreement. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Original Agreement</U>&#148; has the meaning set forth in the recitals. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Original Agreement Effective Date</U>&#148; means September&nbsp;18, 2020. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Partnership</U>&#148; has the meaning set forth in the preamble and includes its successors. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Partnership Agreement</U>&#148; has the meaning set forth in the recitals. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Permitted Transferee</U>&#148; means any Person to whom a Class&nbsp;B Holder or Greenspring Holder has validly transferred Class&nbsp;B Units or
Class&nbsp;C Units in accordance with, and not in contravention of, the Partnership Agreement. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Person</U>&#148; means and includes an
individual, a corporation, a joint venture, a partnership, a limited liability company, an estate, a trust, an unincorporated organization, a government or any department or agency thereof, or any entity similar to any of the foregoing. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Preferred Stock</U>&#148; shall mean the preferred stock, par value $0.001 per share, of the Company. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Secretary</U>&#148; means the Secretary of the Class&nbsp;B Committee, as designated by the Class&nbsp;B Committee from time to time. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Sunset</U>&#148; has the meaning assigned to such term in the Company&#146;s Amended and Restated Certificate of Incorporation. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<U>Voting Power</U>&#148; of a Committee Member means, at the time of determination, the total number of votes which such Committee Member is entitled
to cast in the general election of directors of the Company (or, in the event the entity is not a corporation, the governing members, board or other similar body of such entity). For purposes of this definition, a Committee Member shall be deemed
entitled to vote any securities that such Person Beneficially Owns; <U>provided,</U> that, if securities are Beneficially Owned by more than one Committee Member, then for purposes of this definition the votes of such securities will be deemed
allocated among such Committee Members in any manner they shall agree in a writing delivered to the Company or, in the absence of such a writing, equally among such Committee Members. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">3 </P>

</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>ARTICLE II </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>CORPORATE GOVERNANCE </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Section&nbsp;2.1
<U>Class</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;B Committee</U>. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(a) <U>Initial Composition of the Class</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;B Committee</U>. As of the Effective Date, the
Class&nbsp;B Committee comprises Monte Brem, Scott Hart, Jason Ment, Jose Fernandez, Johnny Randel, Michael McCabe, Mark Maruszewski, Thomas Keck, Thomas Bradley, David Jeffrey and Darren Friedman. As of the Effective Date, Monte Brem is the Chair
and Jason Ment is the Secretary. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(b) <U>Term of the Committee Members</U>. Each Committee Member shall serve until the earliest to occur of: (i)&nbsp;the
Sunset, (ii)&nbsp;the time at which such Person ceases to Beneficially Own any shares of Class&nbsp;B Common Stock, and (iii)&nbsp;the time at which such Committee Member is removed pursuant to <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;2.1(f)</U>. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(c) <U>Action by the Class</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;B Committee</U>. Unless otherwise stated in this Agreement, any action to be taken, approved or adopted by the
Class&nbsp;B Committee shall be deemed taken upon the affirmative vote of a Committee Majority (which vote may occur at a meeting or in writing). </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(d)
<U>Composition of the Class</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;B Committee</U>. The Class&nbsp;B Committee may determine from time to time the number of members constituting the Class&nbsp;B Committee. Whenever the Class&nbsp;B Committee increases or decreases the
number of members of the Class&nbsp;B Committee, a notice of such action shall be delivered promptly to all Class&nbsp;B Holders. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(e) <U>Vacancies</U>. In
the event of any vacancy on the Class&nbsp;B Committee, whether as a result of the death, disability, removal or resignation of any Committee Member or by an increase in the number of members of the Class&nbsp;B Committee, a Committee Majority shall
have the exclusive right to appoint a member to fill such vacancy. An appointment to fill a vacancy shall be effected by the vote of Committee Members constituting a Committee Majority (which vote may occur at a meeting or in writing). Written
notice of any appointment shall be promptly delivered to all Class&nbsp;B Holders. No additional action shall be required by this Agreement to effect such appointment, but if any Necessary Action is otherwise required to effect such appointment,
then the Class&nbsp;B Committee or the Class&nbsp;B Holders, as applicable, shall take promptly all such Necessary Action. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(f) <U>Removal</U>. Any
Committee Member may be removed (whether for or without cause) by the vote of Committee Members constituting a Committee Majority (which vote may occur at a meeting or in writing). Written notice of removal (which notice shall state which Committee
Members voted for removal) shall be promptly delivered to all Class&nbsp;B Holders and Greenspring Holders. No additional action shall be required by this Agreement to effect such removal, but if any Necessary Action is otherwise required to effect
such removal, then the Class&nbsp;B Committee or the Class&nbsp;B Holders, as applicable, shall take promptly all such Necessary Action. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(g) <U>Chair</U>.
The Class&nbsp;B Committee may appoint a Chair from time to time and may remove the Chair at any time (whether for or without cause). The powers and duties of the Chair shall include: (i)&nbsp;presiding at meetings of the Class&nbsp;B Committee
(unless otherwise determined by the Class&nbsp;B Committee); (ii) executing, on behalf of the Class&nbsp;B Committee or the Class&nbsp;B Holders, as applicable, any documents or notices required or authorized by this Agreement; and
(iii)&nbsp;performing such other duties as the Class&nbsp;B Committee may from time to time determine. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(h) <U>Secretary</U>. The Class&nbsp;B Committee
may appoint one or more Secretaries from time to time and may remove any such Secretary at any time (whether for or without cause). The powers and duties of the Secretary shall include: (i)&nbsp;acting as Secretary at all meetings of the
Class&nbsp;B Committee and recording the proceedings of such meetings; (ii)&nbsp;seeing that all notices required to be given under this Agreement are duly given; (iii)&nbsp;executing, on behalf of the Class&nbsp;B Committee or the Class&nbsp;B
Holders, as applicable, any documents or notices required or authorized by this Agreement; and (iv)&nbsp;performing such other duties as the Class&nbsp;B Committee may from time to time determine. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">4 </P>

</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Section&nbsp;2.2 <U>Board of Directors</U>. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(a) <U>Composition of Initial Board</U>. As of the Effective Date, the Board of Directors is comprised of Monte Brem, Valerie Brown, Jose Fernandez, Scott
Hart, David Hoffmeister, Thomas Keck, Mark Maruszewski, Michael McCabe, Steven Mitchell, Anne Raymond and Robert Waldo. The Directors are divided into three classes of directors, each of whose members serve for staggered terms (commencing from the
Original Agreement Effective Date) as follows: </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(i) the Class&nbsp;I directors include Monte Brem, Robert Waldo and Valerie Brown; </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(ii) the Class&nbsp;II directors include Jose Fernandez, Thomas Keck, Michael McCabe, and Steven Mitchell; and </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(iii) the Class&nbsp;III directors include Scott Hart, David Hoffmeister, Anne Raymond. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">The initial term of the Class&nbsp;I directors expire at the Company&#146;s first annual meeting of stockholders for the election of directors following the
closing of the Company&#146;s initial public offering; the initial term of the Class&nbsp;II directors shall expire at the Company&#146;s second annual meeting of stockholders for the election of directors following the closing of the Company&#146;s
initial public offering; and the initial term of the Class&nbsp;III directors shall expire at the Company&#146;s third annual meeting for the election of directors following the closing of the Company&#146;s initial public offering. Following the
initial term, each Class&nbsp;I director, Class&nbsp;II director and Class&nbsp;III director shall have a three- year term. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(b) <U>Voting Agreement</U>.
Not less than 90 days prior to the anniversary of the immediately preceding year&#146;s annual meeting of the Company&#146;s stockholders (which anniversary, in the case of the first annual meeting of stockholders following the closing of the
initial public offering of the Company, shall be deemed to be September&nbsp;8, 2020), the Class&nbsp;B Committee shall provide notice (the &#147;<U>Designation Notice</U>&#148;) to the Board of Directors of a list of individuals designated by the
Class&nbsp;B Committee to be elected as directors at the upcoming annual meeting (the &#147;<U>Board Designees</U>&#148;). Subject to the special rights of any holders of one or more series of Preferred Stock to elect directors, the Company, the
Class&nbsp;B Holders and the Greenspring Holders shall take all Necessary Action to cause the Persons designated by the Class&nbsp;B Committee to be the full slate of nominees recommended by the Board of Directors (or any committee or subcommittee
thereof for election as directors at each annual or special meeting of stockholders at which directors are to be elected). Each Class&nbsp;B Holder and Greenspring Holder shall take all Necessary Action (including by voting, or causing to be voted,
all Company Shares that it owns of record or over which it has voting power or control, including all Company Shares owned by it, whether those shares are held by it on the date hereof or hereafter acquired), (x) to elect each nominee for the Board
of Directors identified pursuant to the immediately preceding sentence and (y)&nbsp;with respect to any other matter presented to the stockholders of the Company for consideration, to adopt or reject such matter as directed by the Class&nbsp;B
Committee. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(c) <U>Additional Obligations</U>. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in this <U>Article II</U>, if the Board of Directors determines in
good faith, after consultation with outside legal counsel, that its nomination of a particular Board Designee pursuant to this <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;2.2</U> would constitute a breach of its fiduciary duties or does not otherwise comply with
the corporate governance requirements of the Company pertaining to the Board of Directors (provided that any such determination with respect to any Board Designee pursuant to this <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;2.2</U> shall be made no later than 30
days after the Board of Directors receives the Designation Notice), then the Board of Directors shall inform the Class&nbsp;B Committee in writing of that determination and explain in reasonable detail the basis for it and the Class&nbsp;B Committee
shall, as promptly as reasonably practicable thereafter (but in any event within 10 days) designate another individual for nomination to the Board of Directors, and the Board of Directors and the Company shall take all Necessary Action required by
this <U>Article II</U> with respect to the nomination of such substitute Board Designee. It is hereby acknowledged and agreed that the fact that a particular Board Designee is a Class&nbsp;B Holder or an Affiliate, director, professional, partner,
member, manager, employee or agent of a Class&nbsp;B Holder or is not an &#147;independent director,&#148; as defined by the applicable national securities exchange on which the Company&#146;s Class&nbsp;A Common Stock shall then be listed, shall
not in and of itself constitute an acceptable basis for such determination by the Board of Directors. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(d) <U>Vacancies</U>. The Class&nbsp;B Committee
shall have the exclusive right to request, by delivery of notice to the Board of Directors, the removal of any Board Designee from the Board of Directors (whether for or without cause). Promptly after receipt of any such request, the Company, the
Class&nbsp;B Holders and the Greenspring Holders shall take all Necessary Action to cause the removal (whether for or without cause) of any such Board Designee at the request of the Class&nbsp;B Committee, including, if requested by the Class&nbsp;B
Committee, by calling a special meeting of stockholders for the removal of directors. In the event of the death, disability, removal or resignation of any Board </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">5 </P>

</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
Designees theretofore serving on the Board of Directors, or any increase of the size of the Board of Directors (other than in connection with the provision of special rights to elect directors to
the holders of one or more series of Preferred Stock), the Class&nbsp;B Committee shall have the exclusive right to appoint (or designate a director for appointment) a director to fill the vacancy resulting therefrom (for the remainder of the
then-current term), and the Company, the Class&nbsp;B Holders and the Greenspring Holders shall take any and all Necessary Action to cause any such vacancy to be filled by such replacement or additional directors so designated as promptly as
reasonably practicable. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Section&nbsp;2.3 <U>Stockholder Votes and Consents Generally; Proxy</U>. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(a) Each Class&nbsp;B Holder and Greenspring Holder shall take all Necessary Action to vote (or cause to be voted), or to provide written consent (or cause to
be provided a written consent) in respect of, all Company Shares over which such Class&nbsp;B Holder or Greenspring Holder has voting control in the manner specified by the Class&nbsp;B Committee from time to time. The agreement set forth in the
prior sentence is specifically intended to last for the duration of this Agreement. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(b) To facilitate performance of the parties&#146; obligations under
this <U>Article II</U>, each Class&nbsp;B Holder and Greenspring Holder hereby irrevocably grants to and appoints the persons named as Chair and Secretary from time to time, separately and not jointly and acting on behalf of the Class&nbsp;B
Committee, as such Class&nbsp;B Holder&#146;s or Greenspring Holder&#146;s proxy and <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">attorney-in-fact</FONT></FONT> (with full power of substitution), for and in the name, place and
stead of that Class&nbsp;B Holder or Greenspring Holder, to vote or act by written consent with respect to such Class&nbsp;B Holder&#146;s or Greenspring Holder&#146;s Company Shares, and to grant (or cause to be granted) a consent, proxy or
approval in respect of those Company Shares, in each case in accordance with such Class&nbsp;B Holder&#146;s or Greenspring Holder&#146;s agreements contained in this Agreement. Each Class&nbsp;B Holder and Greenspring Holder hereby affirms that the
proxy set forth in this <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;2.2(b)</U> is irrevocable, coupled with an interest, intended to be valid for the full term of this Agreement (or, if earlier, until the last date permitted by applicable law), and given to
secure the performance of the obligations of such Class&nbsp;B Holder or Greenspring Holder under this Agreement. Such Class&nbsp;B Holder or Greenspring Holder further acknowledges and agrees that such proxy and power of attorney shall constitute a
durable power of attorney, that such proxy and power of attorney is intended to and shall attach to and run with all such Class&nbsp;B Holder&#146;s or Greenspring Holder&#146;s Company Shares; and that any direct or indirect sale, pledge,
hypothecation, gift, bequest, transfer or other disposition (whether by merger, consolidation, operation of law or otherwise) shall be binding upon any such transferee (and shall not become effective unless so binding). For the avoidance of doubt,
except as expressly contemplated by this <U>Section</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;2.2(b)</U>, no Class&nbsp;B Holder or Greenspring Holder has granted a proxy to any Person to exercise the rights of such Class&nbsp;B Holder or Greenspring Holder under this
Agreement or any other agreement to which such Class&nbsp;B Holder or Greenspring Holder is a party. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(c) In furtherance of the foregoing, at the request
of the Class&nbsp;B Committee (or its designee), each Class&nbsp;B Holder and Greenspring Holder shall deposit into a voting trust, in customary form, and for the duration of the term of this Agreement, or such shorter period as the Class&nbsp;B
Committee may request, all Company Shares then held (or thereafter acquired) by such Class&nbsp;B Holder or Greenspring Holder. Any such voting trust shall name the Class&nbsp;B Committee (or its designee) as trustee, and provide that all Company
Shares deposited in the voting trust shall be voted in accordance with this Agreement. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Section&nbsp;2.4 <U>Agreement of Company and Partnership</U>. Each
party hereto hereby agrees that it will take all Necessary Actions to cause the matters addressed by this <U>Article II</U> to be carried out in accordance with the provisions thereof. Without limiting the foregoing, the Secretary of each of the
Company and of Partnership or, if there be no Secretary, such other officer or employee of the Company or of Partnership as may be fulfilling the duties of the Secretary, shall not record any vote or consent or other action contrary to the terms of
this <U>Article II</U>. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Section&nbsp;2.5 <U>Restrictions on Other Agreements</U>. Except as expressly provided above, no Class&nbsp;B Holder or
Greenspring Holder shall grant any proxy or enter into or agree to be bound by any voting trust, agreement or arrangement of any kind with any Person with respect to its Company Shares if and to the extent the terms thereof conflict with the
provisions of this Agreement (whether or not such proxy, voting trust, agreements or arrangements are with other Class&nbsp;B Holders, Greenspring Holders, holders of Company Shares that are not parties to this Agreement or otherwise). </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">6 </P>

</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Section&nbsp;2.6 <U>Mandatory Exchange</U>. If any Class&nbsp;B Holder or Greenspring Holder (x)&nbsp;fails
to comply with any of its obligations hereunder or (y)&nbsp;otherwise materially breaches any provision of this Agreement applicable to him, her or it, the Class&nbsp;B Committee may, in its sole discretion, require the Company, Partnership, such
Class&nbsp;B Holder or such Class&nbsp;C Holder and/or his, her or its respective Permitted Transferee to exchange any or all Class&nbsp;B Units (and any corresponding shares of Class&nbsp;B Common Stock) or Class&nbsp;C Units Beneficially Owned by
such Class&nbsp;B Holder or Greenspring Holder (or any of his, her or its Permitted Transferees), as applicable, for shares of Class&nbsp;A Common Stock pursuant to the terms of the Class&nbsp;B Exchange Agreement or the Class&nbsp;C Exchange
Agreement, as applicable; and in the event of any such exchange, each Person party hereto shall take all Necessary Action to cause the exchange to be effected. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:24pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>ARTICLE III </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>REPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Section&nbsp;3.1 <U>Mutual Representations and Warranties</U>. Each of the parties to this Agreement hereby represents and warrants to each other party to
this Agreement that as of the Effective Date: </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(a) <U>Existence; Authority; Enforceability</U>. Such party has the power and authority to enter into this
Agreement and to carry out its obligations hereunder. If such party is an entity, it is duly organized and validly existing under the laws of its jurisdiction of organization, and the execution of this Agreement, and the consummation of the
transactions contemplated herein, have been authorized by all necessary action, and no other act or proceeding on its part is necessary to authorize the execution of this Agreement or the consummation of any of the transactions contemplated hereby.
If such party is a natural person, such person has full capacity to contract. This Agreement has been duly executed by each of the parties hereto and constitutes his, her or its legal, valid and binding obligation, enforceable against him, her or it
in accordance with its terms, except as enforcement may be limited by applicable bankruptcy, insolvency, reorganization, moratorium, fraudulent transfer and similar laws relating to or affecting creditors&#146; rights generally, or by the general
principles of equity. No representation is made by any party with respect to the regulatory effect of this Agreement, and each of the parties has had an opportunity to consult with counsel as to his, her or its rights and responsibilities under this
Agreement. No party makes any representation to any other party as to future law or regulation or the future interpretation of existing laws or regulations by any governmental authority or self-regulatory organization. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(b) <U>Absence of Conflicts</U>. The execution and delivery by such party of this Agreement and the performance of his, her or its obligations hereunder does
not and will not (i)&nbsp;conflict with, or result in the breach of, any provision of the constitutive documents of such party, if any; (ii)&nbsp;result in any violation, breach, conflict, default or event of default (or an event which with notice,
lapse of time, or both, would constitute a default or event of default), or give rise to any right of acceleration or termination or any additional payment obligation, under the terms of any contract, agreement or permit to which such party is a
party or by which such party&#146;s assets or operations are bound or affected; or (iii)&nbsp;violate any law applicable to such party. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(c)
<U>Consents</U>. Other than any consents which have already been obtained, no consent, waiver, approval, authorization, exemption, registration, license or declaration is required to be made or obtained by such party in connection with the
execution, delivery or performance of this Agreement. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Section&nbsp;3.2 <U>Representations and Warranties of the Class</U><U></U><U>&nbsp;B Holders</U>.
Each Class&nbsp;B Holder hereby represents and warrants to each other party to this Agreement that, as of the Effective Date, the shares of Common Stock and Class&nbsp;B Units, in each case as listed for such Class&nbsp;B Holder and/or its Permitted
Transferee on the Company&#146;s records as of the Effective Date, are Beneficially Owned by such Class&nbsp;B Holder or its Permitted Transferee, free and clear of all liens, pledges, security interests, charges, claims, encumbrances, agreements,
